alert.note: Alert for Fisher; Haskell; Jones; Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:12PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Haskell, northwestern Jones, northwestern Nolan and Fisher Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 711 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles northeast of Swenson to Rotan to Colorado City Airport. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sweetwater, Hamlin, Roscoe, Rotan, Roby, Rule, Rochester, Weinert, O`brien, Sylvester, Hobbs, Mccaulley, Longworth, Neinda, Sagerton, Wastella, Champion, Lake Sweetwater, Jud and The Intersection Of Ranch Road 608 And Highway 147. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 230 and 255. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for west central Texas.
